text: At NavVis, we're bridging the gap between

the digital and physical worlds
through reality capture technology.

NavVis builds industry leading wearable
and handheld laser scanning systems,

as well as NavVis Ivion, our SaaS platform
for managing and accessing your 3D data.

NavVis Ivion
takes point clouds and panoramic images

and transforms them
into an immersive space.

This space is inaccessible by any standard
web browser and brings the power

of 3D data to all user types. So NavVis
serves a variety of different customers.

Surveyors and laser scanning
professionals.

Experts in the architecture,
engineering and construction industries,

as well as enterprise operations
in the automotive

manufacturing and process industries.
In the automotive sector

using NavVis technology
can reduce planning errors

and reduce costs
associated with late changes up to 30%.

By using NavVis Ivion, best practice
sharing is simplified and the reduction

in travel for industrial engineers
and planners can be up to 40%.

So at NavVis,
we are utilizing AWS services to host

and manage
thousands of installations of NavVis Ivion.

We're able to utilize
a flexible storage solution

to be able to scale
infinitely with our customers,

as they're capturing the reality data.
With our Ivion processing feature

we use the power of AWS cloud compute
to crunch through the petabytes

of data that we store
and manage for our customers.
We use elastic load balancing

to make sure that our clusters are always
stable and scalable for our customers.
Scalability is a big topic for us.

We're constantly growing in terms
of number of NavVis Ivion installations,
weekly active users and data stored.

We love that we're able
to flexibly scale up without needing

to do a lot of pre-planning
or projecting our usage.

Our customer base is global,
so we like that we can have our data near

them and utilize data centers from AWS
in a variety of different locations.

Security and compliance
is really important to our customers

and we know that with AWS,
their data will be secure.

We want to democratize access
to spatial data, and once users

have access to this data, they can use it
to explore and plan future reality.

To do so, we need to transform our data
into an object based representation.

From there, this data can be modified,
have objects added, and be used to plan

the successful future for our customers
and help them build better reality.
